summary: SummaryTonique Douceur Alcohol Free Toner freshener by Lancôme is soothing and cooling. This alcohol-free, pH balanced freshener gently tones and refines skin without drying or depleting natural oils.
details: DetailsFeaturesSoothing and cooling, this alcohol-free, pH balanced freshener gently tones and refines skin without drying or depleting natural oilsFormulated with skin-softening distilled flower-water, this ultra-refreshing formula gives skin a cool, hydrated feelingLeaves skin perfectly clean, soft and suppleSkin feels smooth, completely comfortable and refreshedBenefitsNon-comedogenicDermatologist tested for safetyItem 2235585IngredientsAqua / Water / Eau, Glycerin, Sodium Citrate, CI 42090 / Blue 1, CI 14700 / Red 4, PEG-60 Hydrogenated Castor Oil, Chlorphenesin, Sambucus Nigra Flower, Water, Linalool, Benzyl Alcohol, Propylparaben, Alpha-Isomethyl Ionone, Geraniol, Rosa Centifolia Flower Water, Rosa Centifolia Water / Rosa Centifolia Flower Water, Methylparaben, Tetrasodium EDTA, Citronellol, Hexylene Glycol, Parfum / Fragrance.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
ingredients: Rosa Centifolia Water / Rosa Centifolia Flower Water

reviews.headline: I would buy this product again and again
reviews.comments: Not too astringent but enough to get the day off of your face.

reviews.headline: Just Okay For The Pricepoint
reviews.comments: Tried this because Ulta was out of the milky toner in the pink bottle.  It is just okay; for the price point and  based on other products.  I will use up the bottle but doubt I will purchase again.  They need to redesign the dispenser opening because it is way too easy to dispense too much product and that is a waste, especially at this price point.

reviews.headline: Lancôme products
reviews.comments: Lancôme has superior products. I have used many lines of products in my 76 years of life and Lancôme serves me the best.

reviews.headline: Love Lancôme
reviews.comments: I've been using Lancôme for 30+ years. Love this toner. I asked my niece (she in in cosmetology school) if she would recommend another and she said there isn't any better.

reviews.headline: Doesn't keep my skin clear
reviews.comments: I wish they wouldn't have gotten rid of the original one. Yes it had alcohol in it, but boy did it clear up my skin. This one doesn't do anything for me and ever since I had to switch, my skin hasn't been clear and it's been a struggle trying to find a toner that will do the same as the original.

reviews.headline: Nice feel!
reviews.comments: It is a great follow-up to my cleansing regimen  and does not dry me out.  I would buy it again.

reviews.headline: Heavily fragranced
reviews.comments: This felt immediately heavy on my skin and the fragrance was off putting. I'd like to see Lancôme release a version that is lighter and unscented (or barely scented).

reviews.headline: My Favorite of All
reviews.comments: I use it twice daily.  If toners aren't alcohol free, I don't use them.

reviews.headline: My all time fave toner!!!
reviews.comments: I was recommended this by a Lancôme adviser many years ago. I was using Cliniques toner but it kept drying me out. I switched to this and haven't stopped using it. I would always get the two big sizes during the gifts with purchase. I will never use another toner again.

reviews.headline: Feels great
reviews.comments: I love how this makes my skin feel.

reviews.headline: Great product 30+ years
reviews.comments: Use a pure cotton ball to apply. But first clean your skin. I have good skin but large pores in T-spot. I've used Sea Breeze sensitive OTC since high school for breakouts. It contains eucalyptus and clove oils. It goes down into your pores and acts as antibacterial. Use cotton ball with it too. Then apply the toner. Then apply a light moisturizer. Go bare or makeup. Those pre-steps are your defense against makeup getting down in your pores. This toner is also great on lips and nails.

reviews.headline: Love
reviews.comments: This toner is great! It feels great on the skin, its non-drying and overall my skin just looks and feels better in combination with the Anti-Aging cleanser from Peter Thomas Roth. I started using both at the same time and my breakouts have gone way down, as well as brighter skin.

reviews.headline: I love how this works
reviews.comments: This works great for me since most toners have alcohol in them and this doesn't. With cold Michigan winters, I don't want my face to dry out and start peeling. It feels good and gets it ready for the rest of my routine.

reviews.headline: Nice Toner
reviews.comments: This toner works well and does not dry out my skin.  I often order the big bottle and transfer the product into the smaller bottle for storage purposes.

reviews.headline: I love this
reviews.comments: I love how it makes my face feel afterwards. With cold weather coming soon, alcohol in some toners will dry out your skin. This has no alcohol so I don't have to worry about dryness.

reviews.headline: Non drying
reviews.comments: Love this product. It is non drying to my nirmal to oily skin. Been using it for a few days now and I'm loving it so far. I have no reactions to it and my skin feels clean fresh and hydrated.

reviews.headline: Not alcohol Free!
reviews.comments: I checked the ingredients after I caused my eczema to flair up and it states "benzyl alcohol" on the bottle... pretty disappointed because I love Lancôme products

reviews.headline: HOLY GRAIL
reviews.comments: I have struggled with cystic acne for a long time. I have oily skin that is very sensitive. No other toner I have ever used has been this great. In the morning, I now skip using a stripping cleanser and use this instead. My skin has never been better. Breakouts happen less often and my skin always feels hydrated after using this.

reviews.headline: Toner saved my skin for the summer
reviews.comments: I put it on one cotton round and gently wipe down my face. Then I put moisturizer and a serum on once every night or in the morning too. This routine has helped save my skin especially with this specific toner my skin is much softer, healthier, less breakout and my skin is more alive and less broken.

reviews.headline: Do not recommend
reviews.comments: The first 4 ingredients in order are: water, glycerin, sodium citrate, and artificial color. Essentially this is a bottle of blue glycerin. Glycerin is a good ingredient. It is a humectant that is able to draw moisture from the environment and hydrate the skin. But the rest of the ingredients are underwhelming. There is a strong perfume like smell and enough blue dye to stain your bathroom counter if it spills. There are sooooooo many better toners out there.

properties.name: Best Uses

values.label: Use in spray bottle to refresh

display_values: Use in spray bottle to refresh

properties.name: Cons

values.label: wish it had a pump to dispense

display_values: wish it had a pump to dispense

properties.name: Pros

values.label: Use all over face & neck (including eyes)

display_values: Use all over face & neck (including eyes)

faceoff_positive.comments: Holy grail this product does wonder. Tried it for the 1st time yesterday and again today and my skin felt completely soft and hydrated. I felt like it worked with my other skin care products and not against it. It is defiantly worth the price. Ive had bad experience with toners in the past but this one is far by the best for my skin.  Cons are that it can be messy because the hole where you pure the toner out of is large and it is very easy to waste it or use more than desired. Another con is that it has a fragrance.  I personally love the fragrance but for someone who has sensitive skin it may not be ideal. I was told it can used for all skin types but because it is so hydrating if one has oily skin it may or may not be too much in regards to hydration. But all in all dont take my word for it. Its a try it for yourself product.  Lacome products have never left me or my skin disappointed.
faceoff_positive.headline: A must

faceoff_negative.comments: The first 4 ingredients in order are: water, glycerin, sodium citrate, and artificial color. Essentially this is a bottle of blue glycerin. Glycerin is a good ingredient. It is a humectant that is able to draw moisture from the environment and hydrate the skin. But the rest of the ingredients are underwhelming. There is a strong perfume like smell and enough blue dye to stain your bathroom counter if it spills. There are sooooooo many better toners out there.
faceoff_negative.headline: Do not recommend
